about.name: Rajpreet Singh Nayyar
about.title: Software Engineer III | C# • .NET Core • Microservices • Checkout & Loyalty Systems
about.bio: Software Engineer with specialized experience in travel e-commerce Checkout systems, including Cart, loyalty, rewards, promotions, and purchase flows. I build and operate high-availability, customer-facing platforms across India and the United States, focusing on clean APIs, pragmatic system design, and production reliability. I enjoy solving rules-heavy problems (like reward points decisioning), building observable services, and shipping features that hold up as products scale.

timeline.description: Subject Matter Expert for Checkout loyalty and promotions. Owned production reliability and delivered major rewards initiatives across a high-availability travel e-commerce platform.
achievements: Served as SME for Cart & Checkout, owning technical and business workflows across booking, rewards, and purchase flows.
Led knowledge transfer for US-based teams through architecture walkthroughs, business-flow deep dives, and production-readiness reviews.
Provided heavy production support (SEV triage, RCA, resolution) and partnered with SRE/platform teams to improve operational stability and incident response.
Delivered major initiatives including Dynamic Points Burn, Chase Promotional Offers, Preserve Burn, and Cruise onboarding by extending Checkout workflows for new validations and booking requirements.

Designed and implemented a rule-driven points allocation algorithm for Preserve Burn to optimally apply preserved and newly earned points under distinct accrual/burn rules; presented and validated the solution during on-site workshops in India prior to go-live.

timeline.description: Code owner for Cart Engine with squad-level delivery leadership across Checkout initiatives, planning/estimation, and observability.
achievements: Served as code owner for Cart Engine, responsible for architecture decisions, daily code reviews, and code quality.
Led delivery squads from a technical and business perspective, contributing to capacity planning, estimation, requirement analysis, and full-stack development.
Led a cross-functional squad (3 developers, 1 QA, 1 Business Analyst) to deliver Fee in Points, enabling customers to pay order fees using reward points.
Led a larger cross-functional group (developers, QA, DevOps, BA) to deliver the Traveler Information Page, a critical Checkout component gathering traveler data required for booking.
Supported multiple client launches (from Q3 2022 onward) from the Cart platform in collaboration with Chase and external client teams.
Invited to Plano, Texas (Dec 2022) for a working session with a major client to evaluate technical and business feasibility of promotional offers in Checkout.
Built and maintained real-time dashboards using Grafana and Kibana; used Dynatrace for system health analysis, performance monitoring, and end-to-end user session tracing.

timeline.description: Backend and UI contributions across Cart/Checkout services, payments flows, asynchronous processing, and monitoring.
achievements: Developed backend APIs for Cart and Checkout using C# and .NET Core to support core booking and purchase flows.
Delivered Cart-Level Payments and contributed to Checkout-adjacent services including Payments (PCI-compliant), Fraud Check, One-Use Card, OFAC Watchdog, BIN Validation, and X-Factor.
Built and optimized asynchronous processing using RabbitMQ (actor-based queuing) to improve throughput and system performance.
Implemented observability with Grafana, Kibana, and Dynatrace to improve visibility into system health, booking failures, and performance metrics.
Worked on Angular-based UI for Cart/Checkout flows; built reusable UI components using Lit Elements and styling with SCSS, Flexbox, and CSS Grid; applied microservices and BFF patterns.
Applied strong engineering practices including TDD, code coverage (Coverlet), and centralized configuration management (Consul).
Supported analytics enablement by integrating DNA Analytics to improve insights into user behavior and feature adoption.

timeline.description: Built a data analytics and visualization UI, integrating charts, material UI components, and reporting workflows.
achievements: Developed a data visualization UI using Angular for the ORXe Data Analyzer tool.
Implemented interactive charts and graphs using CanvasJS by consuming trends from backend APIs.
Integrated Angular Material components (forms, autocomplete, tabs) for a clean, responsive UX.
Built an Email API to automate delivery of statistical reports to specified recipients.
Implemented Angular fundamentals (directives, routing, services) to meet functional requirements; wrote UI tests using Jest.

items.title: Virtual Traveler Map
items.description: An interactive map where users enter destination + dates and get personalized hotel/resort/activity recommendations.

items.description: Undergraduate degree focused on computer science fundamentals and software engineering.
